content:
I'd be happy to help.

Many art museums and galleries are open on Sundays, but it's always best to confirm their hours before heading out. Here are some popular art museums and galleries that are commonly open on Sundays:

**United States:**

1. The Metropolitan Museum of Art (The Met) - New York City, NY (open Sunday to Thursday, 10am-5:30pm, Friday and Saturday, 10am-8pm)
2. The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) - New York City, NY (open daily, 10:30am-5:30pm)
3. National Gallery of Art - Washington, D.C. (open Monday to Saturday, 10am-5pm, Sunday, 11am-6pm)
4. Art Institute of Chicago - Chicago, IL (open daily, 10:30am-5pm, Thursday until 8pm)
5. Getty Center - Los Angeles, CA (open daily, 10am-5:30pm, Friday until 9pm)
6. San Francisco Museum of Modern Art (SFMOMA) - San Francisco, CA (open Friday to Tuesday, 10am-5pm, Thursday, 10am-8pm, closed Wednesdays)

**Europe:**

1. The Louvre - Paris, France (open daily, 9am-6pm, Wednesdays and Fridays until 9:45pm)
2. Tate Modern - London, UK (open daily, 10am-6pm, Friday and Saturday until 10pm)
3. Prado Museum - Madrid, Spain (open Monday to Saturday, 10am-8pm, Sunday, 10am-7pm)
4. Uffizi Gallery - Florence, Italy (open Tuesday to Sunday, 8:15am-6:50pm)
5. Rijksmuseum - Amsterdam, Netherlands (open daily, 9am-5pm)

**Other countries:**

1. National Gallery of Canada - Ottawa, Canada (open Tuesday to Sunday, 10am-5pm, Thursday until 8pm)
2. National Museum of Western Art - Tokyo, Japan (open Tuesday to Sunday, 9:30am-5:30pm, Friday until 8pm)
3. National Gallery of Australia - Canberra, Australia (open daily, 10am-5pm)

Please note that hours may change, and some museums may have special exhibitions or events that affect their regular hours. I recommend checking the museum's website or calling ahead to confirm their Sunday hours before planning your visit.
